pullRequest.body:
The few useful lemmas can go to `Data.Subtype.Basic` and the other ones can be deleted.


---

nodes.body:
LGTM besides the CI error,

bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8558240774/job/23452357370)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8558240774/job/23452357615)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8558240774/job/23452357115)
I believe we don't like `#noalign`s, and prefer lemmas that roughly match, e.g. `Subtype.instInhabitedSubtype` (which probably matches exactly?)

```suggestion
#noalign subtype.tag_irrelevant
#noalign subtype.exists_of_subtype
#align subtype.inhabited Subtype.instInhabitedSubtype
```
(how is that even an instance, though?)
Fair point, I don't think it can ever be succesfully applied.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: Delete `Init.Data.Subtype.Basic`
